Column Comment.0: ZONE DEFINITION IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for amineral zone definition that iscreated and maintained by a regulatory or other agency as one of a set of standards.May also be an ad hoc definition for the land zone that is created by an owner oradministrator.
Column Comment.1: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.2: BASE DEPTH: Depth to the base of the mineral zone definition
Column Comment.3: BASE DEPTH ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE:
Column Comment.4: BASE QUALIFIER: Indicates whether the base of the zone is referenced to the top orbottom of a formation or zone.
Column Comment.5: STRATIGRAPHIC UNIT IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the stratigraphic unit.
Column Comment.6: STRATIGRAPHIC UNIT IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the stratigraphic unit.
Column Comment.7: DESCRIPTION: textual description of the mineral zone definition
Column Comment.8: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.9: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.10: OWNER BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: the unique identifier for the business associatewho is the owner of this land zone definition (usually a governmental or regulatoryagency).
Column Comment.11: OWNER REFERENCE NUMBER: the reference or identification number (code)assigned to this mineral zone by the owner.
Column Comment.12: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.13: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.14: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.15: STRATIGRAPHIC NAME SET NAME: a unique name of the the set of stratigrapahicnames to which the STRAT UNITS belong. A stratigraphic name set is a collection ofstratigraphic units, such as may be in use for a geographic area, a project, acompany etc.
Column Comment.16: TOP DEPTH: the depth to the top of the mineral zone that is defined.
Column Comment.17: TOP DEPTH ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE:
Column Comment.18: TOP QUALIFIER: Indicates whether the top of the zone is referenced to the top orbottom of a formation or zone.
Column Comment.19: STRATIGRAPHIC UNIT IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the stratigraphic unit.
Column Comment.20: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row. In the case, the UWI is the one upon which the land zonedefinition is based.
Column Comment.21: ZONE DERIVATION METHOD: Type of log on which the definition is based, such asBorehole compensated sonic, induction electric, induction gamma ray etc.
Column Comment.22: ZONE TYPE: The type of mineral zone definiton, such as zone definition or DRRZD(Deep rights reversion zone definition).
Column Comment.23: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.24: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.25: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.26: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.27: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.28: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.29: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
